event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item:
Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected CPU, the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u <EVENT_ID>.

The event-id can be found in the EVENT-ID field of the message. For example:

    EVENT-ID: d05a9f16-e969-4988-d340-dea1b54bd307
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of errors associated with a CPU has exceeded acceptable levels.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Message ID:   %MSGID% indicates that the Solaris[TM] Fault Manager has received reports from a CPU that one or more errors in the Data cache (dCache), internal to the CPU, have been detected. The Diagnostic Engine (DE) has triggered an automatic response to disable and isolate this CPU from the configuration in order to prevent repeat errors and increase the system's total Availability.

Arrangements should be made to replace the Field Replaceable Unit (FRU) on which the suspect CPU is located. Refer to the information displayed in the FRU: field of the fmdump output. For example: 

    %fmdump -v -u d05a9f16-e969-4988-d340-dea1b54bd307 
TIME                 UUID                                 SUNW-MSG-ID 
Sep 06 21:03:05.4129 d05a9f16-e969-4988-d340-dea1b54bd307 SUN4U-8006-VD 
  100%  fault.cpu.ultraSPARC-IIIiplus.dcache
        FRU: hc:///component=Slot A 
        rsrc: cpu:///cpuid=0/serial=D27081B5443
event_registry_properties.name: impact
po-action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected CPU, the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u <EVENT_ID>.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The fault manager will attempt to remove the affected CPU from service.
event_registry_properties.name: title
